title: Job 6:1
text: BUT Job answered and said,

title: Job 6:2
text: Oh that my grief were throughly weighed, and my calamity laid in the balances together!

title: Job 6:3
text: For now it would be heavier than the sand of the sea: therefore my words are swallowed up.

title: Job 6:4
text: For the arrows of the Almighty are within me, the poison whereof drinketh up my spirit: the terrors of God do set themselves in array against me.

title: Job 6:5
text: Doth the wild ass bray when he hath grass?  or loweth the ox over his fodder?

title: Job 6:6
text: Can that which is unsavoury be eaten without salt?  or is there any taste in the white of an egg?

title: Job 6:7
text: The things that my soul refused to touch are as my sorrowful meat.

title: Job 6:8
text: Oh that I might have my request; and that God would grant me the thing that I long for!

title: Job 6:9
text: Even that it would please God to destroy me; that he would let loose his hand, and cut me off!

title: Job 6:10
text: Then should I yet have comfort; yea, I would harden myself in sorrow: let him not spare; for I have not concealed the words of the Holy One.

title: Job 6:11
text: What is my strength, that I should hope?  and what is mine end, that I should prolong my life?

title: Job 6:12
text: Is my strength the strength of stones?  or is my flesh of brass?

title: Job 6:13
text: Is not my help in me?  and is wisdom driven quite from me?

title: Job 6:14
text: To him that is afflicted pity should be shewed from his friend; but he forsaketh the fear of the Almighty.

title: Job 6:15
text: My brethren have dealt deceitfully as a brook, and as the stream of brooks they pass away;

title: Job 6:16
text: Which are blackish by reason of the ice, and wherein the snow is hid:

title: Job 6:17
text: What time they wax warm, they vanish: when it is hot, they are consumed out of their place.

title: Job 6:18
text: The paths of their way are turned aside; they go to nothing, and perish.

title: Job 6:19
text: The troops of Tema looked, the companies of Sheba waited for them.

title: Job 6:20
text: They were confounded because they had hoped; they came thither, and were ashamed.

title: Job 6:21
text: For now ye are nothing; ye see my casting down, and are afraid.

title: Job 6:22
text: Did I say, Bring unto me?  or, Give a reward for me of your substance?

title: Job 6:23
text: Or, Deliver me from the enemy's hand?  or, Redeem me from the hand of the mighty?

title: Job 6:24
text: Teach me, and I will hold my tongue: and cause me to understand wherein I have erred.

title: Job 6:25
text: How forcible are right words!  but what doth your arguing reprove?

title: Job 6:26
text: Do ye imagine to reprove words, and the speeches of one that is desperate, which are as wind?

title: Job 6:27
text: Yea, ye overwhelm the fatherless, and ye dig a pit for your friend.

title: Job 6:28
text: Now therefore be content, look upon me; for it is evident unto you if I lie.

title: Job 6:29
text: Return, I pray you, let it not be iniquity; yea, return again, my righteousness is in it.

title: Job 6:30
text: Is there iniquity in my tongue?  cannot my taste discern perverse things?
